Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2006025499.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1976, Anthony Malinak and friends arrived at Long Lake and fished during the day. That evening Mr. Malinak had taken a boat from Mountain Lodge on Long Lake. The boat was found at the east end of the lake in a foot of water.  Mr. Malinak's rain jacket and hat were found in the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2024035450.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2024, the body of this unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River in the United States.

Hair: Black, Bald, Short, Short facial hair, black and grey

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1998. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2012020645.CaseDesc: Peter Mckay was playing on the ice along the South Saskatchewan River in the Riversdale area of Saskatoon, SK in the late afternoon hours of December 31, 1986. Peter subsequently fell into an open portion of the river and was never found.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Orange, with a yellow stripe on the cuff

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday 19 June 2008. Jennifer was last seen leaving Grand Rapids at approximately 12:00 p.m. en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels, it is believed that she was dropped off near the junction of Waterhen - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Jennifer has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002185.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Géraldine Dufresne was seen for the last time at her residence in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec. Géraldine did not report to work, nor did she inform her employer of her absence. All of her belongings were left in her apartment.

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1995, Ms. Runningbird was seen for the last time, she was out near Swan Lake, walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2020008388.CaseDesc: On December 10, 1982, David Templar was seen for the last time when he was picked up by his father for a visitation. David was to be returned home to his mother on December 12, but never returned. It is believed that his father may have brought him to India.

Coat: Other, Parka; Khaki coloured with white fur trim on hood

Case reference: 2014003355.CaseDesc: Kelsey Brew and his friends were playing on the rocks on the shores of the Hudson Bay in Churchill. According to the witness Kelsey attempted to help another boy who had fallen in the water. As Kelsey was helping, a wave came in and he also slipped into the water. A large number of volunteers walked the shoreline and boat patrols failed to locate him. It is assumed Kelsey drowned.

Scar: Cheek, 3 on left side of face

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Hair: Short, Straight, Dark, straight hair approximately 2-3" in length
Shirt: Grey, Patterned, may have been blue and white

Case reference: 2014005268.CaseDesc: On 26 May 2009, Harold Dorion was reported missing to the Nelson House RCMP (Nisichawayasihk Cree Nation) in Manitoba. Investigations later established that he was last seen in the last week of July 2007. There have been no sightings or contact with Harold since that time. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 2014004877.CaseDesc: On February 9, 2006, Michelle Mercer was seen for the last time walking away from an argument with her boyfriend, in the area of 105 Street and 69 Avenue in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2019003520.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2019, Addrienne McRobert was seen for the last time leaving the residence of a friend in Oshawa, Ontario.

Coat: Black, Hooded, "BENCH" written vertically on the back
Tattoo: Left Thigh, Text: Forever & Always & Derek

Case reference: 2016053812.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2016, at approximately 2:30 a.m., Van Pham was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2024015900.CaseDesc: Mary Clarke left her residence in Guelph, Ontario, on April 8, 1990.  Her vehicle was later found abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Coat: Wool, Blue, Tan, Knee length tweed trench coat.

Case reference: 2014005610.CaseDesc: Roman Drag was last seen in the early hours of May 23, 2011 fishing at the top of the Bassano Dam in Bassano, AB. Roman and a friend were night fishing on the shore of the Bow River. His black jacket and fishing gear were found in the place where he was last seen. Search teams located a pair of glasses but were not able to locate Roman.

Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2013000110.CaseDesc: Robert Gorassi is a full time resident in Toronto and was on an outing at Kinark Outdoor Centre where he was last seen at 4:30 p.m on October 25, 2012.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Grizzled beard, moustache & sideburns

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2012020065.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1979, Shane Olecka was reported missing to the Beausejour RCMP. Shane was last seen leaving his home the previous day to go rabbit hunting. He was an experienced woodsman and there was no logical reason for him to be overdue. The weather conditions worsened to 'blizzard-like' on December 3rd and made the search efforts very difficult. The police conducted ground searches with the assistances of a police dog, members from the Canadian Forces base and local volunteers. The ground search was terminated on December 8th due to inclement weather.

Jacket: Blue, Rabbit-fur trim on hood, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2015054218.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2015 Heather Coburn was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York, United States. At the time of her disappearance, Heather was despondent.

Foreign Object: Right Hip, Pins in right hip
Right Jaw, Dental implant in upper jaw

Case reference: 2014002848.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Daniel McKenzie was seen for the last time. Daniel was reported missing after he was seen leaving a taxi, and running into the wilderness along the Quebec and Labrador border.

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2021022793.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2021, Thomas Grise was seen for the last time at a family members residence in Sturgeon Lake Cree Nation, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic was last seen in Sackville, New Brunswick, at around 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. He had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night. After receiving information that a person was observed at approximately 5:30 a.m. on Sunday walking on Upper Aboujagane Road, authorities focused their search in a wooded area and river off Route 940 heading toward Shemogue.

Deformity: Unknown, Crooked fingers on left hand

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring
Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2022049190.CaseDesc: On September 28th, 2022, Joey Flett was seen for the last time after leaving a property in Gift Lake, Alberta. The vehicle Joey was reported to be driving was located at a rural location.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006008799.CaseDesc: Doris Fennell was last observed at the home of an acquaintace in Kitley-Elizabeth Township, near Addison, Ontario. Foul Play is strongly suspected in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000097.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1981, police received a call regarding the drowning of Deanne Bousquet. Three children were playing on the ice on the river when two of the children broke through. Deanne was unable to pull herself out and was last seen going under the water. Ice in the area was very thin due to warm water being dumped by the mill. All efforts made to locate Deanne were negative.

Case reference: 2014004267.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2002, Jason MacMillan was reported missing. His brother last saw Jason on December 10, 2002 at 12:30 am when they were together on Jasper Avenue and 102 Street in Edmonton, Alberta.

Scar: Neck, scar on his neck in the throat area

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 2024015856.CaseDesc: Janine was last seen on March 30, 2024, walking near Township Road 534 and Range Road 185, heading towards Mundare, Alberta.  Janine was known to hitchhike.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014005032.CaseDesc: Edward Dufresne was last seen on 12 April 1993 at his home in Ste-Félicité, Quebec. He lived alone in a small house on Route 132. Edward regularly walked along the roads, picked mussels by the water, and also went into the forest to hunt for small game.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With keys tied to a string

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2015056570.CaseDesc: John Hastings left his sister's apartment in downtown Winnipeg, Manitoba, on October 15, 2015. John was feeling despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Moon and Star

Case reference: 2015064360.CaseDesc: Josephine Martin was last seen in the early morning hours of November 15, 2015, near Edwards Avenue in The Pas, Manitoba.  Extensive searches were conducted with no success.  Josephine follows a high-risk lifestyle, and her family and friends haven't seen or heard from her since, which is unusual.

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP. Jody had been partying at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in the downtown area of Grande Prairie sometime later that night, or the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Buttocks, Heart Symbol on left side

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2024020668.CaseDesc: Yeghia Meymarian was seen on April 21, 2024, entering the water ways near Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, NY.  At that time Yeghia was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2014016772.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014 around 1PM, Yvon Guevin left his residence in Pierreville, Quebec with his vehicle, a burgundy and gray Jeep Cherokee registered in Quebec. He left with his little black dog, a "miniature Pinscher" named Costaud. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since, which is out of the ordinary.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014002126.CaseDesc: On March 18, 1997, Mark Bird was seen for the last time when he left his home in Welland, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Mark was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Black, Hooded, San Francisco 49's football team

Case reference: 2022039393.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2022, Angela Breau was seen for the last time at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She left her residence without her dentures, wallet, or other personal effects.  At the time of her disappearance, Angela was suffering from mental health issues and she has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021037317.CaseDesc: On 18 August, 2021, Kari Campbell was seen for the last time in the Durham Bridge region of York County, New Brunswick. Kari has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006017299.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1998, Jake Just attended a party at a residence in the north end of the town of Midland. He was last seen walking home from the party, then separating from his friends to take a short cut through a wooded area. An extensive search of the area turned up negative.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Gold, jaguar logo and gold stitching
Shoes: Canvas, Black, Blue, "DVS" - skateboarder style - size 11
Scar: Left Upper Arm, 4" raised scar inside bicep

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2020013402.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, Vincent Turcotte was for the last time in the Parc des Berges area of Clermont, Quebec. The bike he was riding was found near the Malbaie River.

Hair: Auburn, Short, Sports a moustache and a little beard
Shoes: Light Green, NIKE AIRJO, "Nike Air Jordan" brand, camouflage
Sweater: Black, Green, HOODIE, Hooded sweatshirt, text "Les Beaux Projects"
Tattoo: Right Hand, Unknown text on fingers

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014002344.CaseDesc: Bradley Verbeek was last seen in London, Ontario on December 8, 1987. His clothing and personal belongings were all left in a house where he was renting a room.

Case reference: 2012002099.CaseDesc: Kelly Coleman was last seen near Mac's Convenience on Mapleview Drive in Barrie, Ontario in August 2011.  Kelly suffers from health-related issues and has not had contact with her family or friends since January 3, 2012. They are concerned for her well-being and are requesting assistance from anyone who may have had any contact with her.

Case reference: 2014005179.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2006, Richard Griffis was seen for the last time when he went down to the White River in the remote community of Beaver Creek in the Yukon. Richard had been visiting from the United States, and had travelled to the Yukon to test out an outdoor survival suit that he invented.

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2014002118.CaseDesc: Henry M’Lot was reported missing by his brother on November 13, 1973. At the time of his disappearance, he was despondent due to the separation with his wife.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Head, Burr hole from operation right front side of skull

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers
Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2012020138.CaseDesc: The 18 month old Yohanna went missing after the mother entrusted the custody of her daughter to her boyfriend while she was out of town for a few days. They all lived in the Saint Laurent area in Montreal. Upon her return to Montreal, the mother was told that her baby was in Washington with the boyfriend’s mother. She went to the United States to find her daughter, but could not locate her. Returning to Quebec, the mother alerted the police of her child’s disappearance. The boyfriend claimed then that the child drowned in the bathtub during the mother’s absence and that she had been buried before the mother’s return. He was questioned and then released due to lack of evidence.

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2020008724.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1979, Irvin Lasinskas was last seen at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Irvin was despondent.
